title: Planet of the plates
lede: Your dining choices hold surprising power. Everyday meals make a global difference through the resources they demand.

title: Vegans and climate carnivores
description: Which diets are best for the planet?
lede: The best diet for the planet isn't about perfection for a select few. It's about the consistent commitment to sustainable eating embraced by many.

title: The 50% food gap
description: Why do we need to increase food production by 50% by 2060?
lede: A looming population boom combined with shifting dietary trends towards resource-intensive foods puts massive pressure on our planet's ability to feed itself in the decades to come.

title: Country foodprints
description: Which high-consuming countries have the greatest potential for change?
lede: Not all nations eat equally. Data reveals the wide disparity in diet-related resource use – some can change more than others.

title: Grasslands and red meat reduction
description: Would reducing beef consumption result in wasted grazing lands?
lede: Reduced red meat demand won't suddenly empty grazing lands or upend livelihoods. However, it could reduce cropland needed for feed and mitigate future deforestation.

title: The role of increased productivity
description: Can better agricultural technology help close the food gap?
lede: Increased production is vital, but technology doesn't exist in a vacuum. A truly sustainable future needs both smarter yields and smarter consumption.

title: Don't have a cow, man
description: What is the single most impactful dietary shift?
lede: Reducing your red meat consumption has an outsized impact on your individual food footprints...and is dead simple to implement.

title: Further reading
description: Links to more articles, reports and datasets.
lede: For those who want to dig deeper into the data and research behind the food and climate change connection.
